groups.description: If the global food supply is to keep pace with population growth and dietary changes, agricultural productivity must increase. Changes in agricultural practices can help the world not only to meet its targets for reducing greenhouse gas emissions but also to contribute to food security.
groups.title: Climate Change Mitigation
groups.name: climate-change-mitigation

organization.title: FAO
organization.name: fao
organization.description: Food and Agriculture Organization of the United Nations

notes: Under the transparency framework, FAO provides countries with technical support on enhancing institutional arrangements for the nationals GHG inventory system (NIS), preparing a national GHG inventory for the Agriculture, Forestry and Other Land Uses (AFOLU) sector, estimate the Forest Reference Level (FRL) and guarantee the Quality Assurance/Quality Control (QA/QC) and verification procedures of the GHG inventory before submissions to UNFCCC.
name: country-experience-on-ghg-inventory-asia-and-the-pacific

resources.name: Myanmar: training on GHG inventory for the AFOLU sector
resources.description: A whole week  of training  on GHG inventory  in Nay Pyi Taw, Myanmar, 13-17 February 2017. This was the first GHG Inventory training on AFOLU ever done in Myanmar and attracted a lot of interest. The main objective of this training week was to map institutional arrangements, identify main data sources for a complete AFOLU inventory and to improve the capacity of the participants to conduct calculations of GHG emissions and removals for the AFOLU sector.

resources.name: Papua New Guinea: support on GHG inventory, preparation of FRL, QA/QC
resources.description: More than 2  year of continuous support starting from the organization of the activity data preparatory for the GHG inventory until the preparation of the GHG inventootry to be included in the BUR. A series of workshop/training have been  organized in the country as well as in FAO HQ.

resources.name: Viet Nam: support on GHG inventory  and NAMA
resources.description: AO Viet Nam and the Ministry have organized capacity development on NAMAs and assessment of GHG emissions. In order to develop a system for monitoring, reporting and verification of the emission, the Viet Nam NAMA project is also measuring GHG emissions from a pilot system of rice production and rice residue utilization for energy generation.

The objectives of the training workshop were to focus on challenges for data sharing, institutional arrangement, and GHG emission estimation tools to outline the current state and provide policy recommendations.
resources.name: Bangladesh: training on data sharing, institutional arrangements and tools for GHG emission
Georgia: support on GHG inventory, QA/QC, and on NAMA preparation
resources.description: In the context of the Information Matters (IM) programme organized by the Deutshe Gesellschaft f√ºr Internationale Zusammenarbeit (GIZ) and hosted by the Ministry of Environment and National Resources Protection of Georgia (MoENRP), a series of capacity training workshops to enhance ambitious reporting and facilitation of International Mutual Learning through Peer-to-Peer Exchange in Georgia.

title: Country experience on GHG inventory: Asia and the Pacific
